title: Upton Country Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Carol Walker / Upton Country park
images.caption: Upton Country Park. This is 100 acres of attractive gardens,parkland and woodland on the shores of Poole harbour. It was opened to the public in 1976 and is now owned and managed by Poole Borough council.

images.title: John Lamper / Peacock Enclosure, Upton Country Park
images.caption: Peacock Enclosure. The beautiful gardens of Upton Country Park are situated in the grounds of Upton House and have more than 100 acres of woodland, parkland and shoreline. The park belongs to Poole and is freely accessible.

images.title: John Lamper / Upton House, Dorset
images.caption: Upton House, though modest in size, echoes the elegance of late 18th Century and early 19th Century Britain. It forms the focal point of the Upton estate (which once extended to a thousand acres) and is now the centre piece of Pooles only Country Park. The House was presented to Poole Council in 1957 and from 1961 to 1969 the House was occupied by Carol Hohenzollern, Prince of Romania. Upton House is now used for conferences, training courses, seminars, meetings, team building days, dinners, buffets, receptions and exhibitions.

images.title: Mike Faherty / Upton, boardwalk
images.caption: Boardwalk and footbridge over a stream rising on Upton Heath, and associated wetlands; in the south-western corner of the country park.

images.title: Upton House, walled garden by Mike Faherty, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: A view of the walled garden

images.title: Upton House, duck pond by Mike Faherty, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Duck pond

description: Upton Country Park, consists of 100 acres of parkland situated on the north west edge of Poole, Dorset. Attractions include formal and informal gardens, open parkland, woodlands, farmland and the Grade II listed Upton House. There are also fine views towards the town across Poole Harbour. The route can be extended to Poole town centre by cycling or walking along the Holes Bay path. Just to the north you'll find the Upton Heath Nature Reserve. There's miles of trails here with fine views towards Poole Harbour and Corfe Castle from the high points. You can also pick up the popular Castleman Trailway here.
